greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of reduced words of length n in the Weyl group A_3.
comment: a(n) is also the number of vertices of a truncated octahedron (the Voronoi cell for the lattice A_3*) at edge distance n from a given vertex. See also row 4 of the triangle in A008302. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 12 2015, corrected Aug 26 2016.
If the zeros are omitted, this is the coordination sequence for the truncated octahedron (see Karzes link). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 08 2020
Computed with MAGMA using commands similar to those used to compute A161409.
reference: N. Bourbaki, Groupes et alg. de Lie, Chap. 4, 5, 6. (The group is defined in Planche I.)
J. E. Humphreys, Reflection Groups and Coxeter Groups, Cambridge, 1990. See under Poincaré polynomial.
formula: G.f. for A_m is the polynomial Product_{k=1..m} (1-x^(k+1))/(1-x). Only finitely many terms are nonzero. This is a row of the triangle in A008302.
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 - x^2) (1 - x^3) (1 - x^4) / (1 - x)^3, {x, 0, 20}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 23 2016 *)
results.author: _John Cannon_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 30 2009
